data.event: The city was founded in 1850 by Andrew Smith and Joel Palmer.
Dayton post office was opened in 1851, with Christopher Taylor serving as postmaster.
The oldest standing structure is the Joel Palmer House, built in 1852 or 1857.
Nearby, in Courthouse Square Park, is the Fort Yamhill Block House, which was brought to Dayton in 1911 to prevent its demolition.

event.title: had been built by Willamette Valley settlers on Fort Hill in the Grand Ronde Valley in 1855

data.event: The structure had been built by Willamette Valley settlers on Fort Hill in the Grand Ronde Valley in 1855 and 1856.
